title: Circular Frontiers: Shaping our Future
description: Opening keynote session exploring how Arctic and Nordic communities can shape the next wave of circular innovation. Overarching theme about circular innovation in the Arctic.
notes: Opening session setting the tone for the summit

title: Circular Ocean Industries
description: Nordic collaboration in blue industry. Discussion covering ocean economy, fisheries, and marine resources with key industry players.
notes: Focus on Royal Greenland, Iceland Ocean Cluster, Danish Ocean Cluster, Halibut Greenland, Polar Seafood

title: Locally Rooted: Materialising a Circular Future
description: Self-sufficiency and resilient local economies. Material innovation session focusing on locally sourced and circular materials, seasonal food, local production and knowledge.
notes: Includes discussion of Arctic food innovation, reindeer, musk ox, fat production with INNOVA

title: Arctic & Nordic Lifestyles
description: Circular traditions, culture and knowledge. Lifestyle and consumption focus exploring sustainable living in Arctic and Nordic regions.
notes: Focus on Nordic Baltic Textile Transition Group, local materials like qiviut

title: Circular Cities and Regions
description: Technology and digitalization in circular transition. Focus on how cities and regions can implement circular economy principles.

title: Partner-Hosted Digital Sessions
description: Full day of digital sessions hosted by Summit Partners, highlighting circular initiatives, research, and case studies from across the Arctic and Nordic region
location: Online + Nalik Venture office + locations around Nuuk
notes: Organized in time slots: 08:00-09:00, 10:00-11:00, 11:30-12:30, 13:00-14:00. Thematic partner sessions include: Nordic Baltic Textile Transition Group, Critical Raw Materials, Circular Knowledge
